title: Online help systems: design and implementation issues (panel)
proctitle: CHI '88: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
abstract: This panel session examines major issues in the design and implementation of online help systems.

references.text: Borenstein, N.S. The Design and Evaluation of On-Line Help Systems. Report CMU-CS-85-151, Dept. Computer Science, Carnegie-Mellon University, 1985.
Carroll, J.M. & McKendree, J. Interface design issues for advice-giving expert systems. Communications of the ACM, Volume 30(1), January 1987, pp 14-31.
Elkerton, J. Online aiding for human-computer interfaces. In M. Helander (Ed.), The Handbook of Human-Computer Interaction. New York: North Holland, in press.
Houghton, R.C. Online help systems: A conspectus. Communications of the ACM, Volume 27 (2), February 1984, pp 126-133.
Judd, W. What, exactly, is your problem? An introduction to dynamic help. Data Training Magazine, August, 1986. pp 36-37.
Kearsley, G. Online Help Systems. Norwood, N.J. Ablex, 1988.
